Remarks:
This resource also can return additional data when using the _reverseInclude parameter to include AuditEvent data. Additional details about how AuditEvent works for this resource are included below. For more information about AuditEvent, refer to the FHIR Search Parameters documentation.

AuditEvent – Pathway Review History

Name

Description

Optional?

Unbounded?

type

Type of “Review History”.

false

false

recorded

The time the event was recorded.

false

false

agent

An actor taking an active role in the event or activity that is logged.

false

true

agent.who

The provider who reviewed the pathway.

true

false

agent.requestor

Always “True”.

false

false

source

The system that is reporting the event.

false

false

source.observer

The user making the FHIR request.

false

false

entity

Specific instances of data or objects that have been accessed.

true

true

entity.what

A link to the pathway resource.

true

false

entity.detail

Tagged value pairs for conveying additional data about the entity.

true

true

entity.detail.type

Always “note”.

false

false

entity.detail.valueString

The Mark As Reviewed comment.

false

false

false

false

Always “True”.

true

true

entity.detail.type

Goal name -> "activity.detail.code", documentation status -> "activity.outcomeCodeableConcept", documentation variance -> "activity.outcomeReference", documentation variance comment -> "activity.progress".

false

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Patient associated with the care plan.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

CarePlan.Name: CarePlan
CarePlan.Description: An instance of the R4 CarePlan resource.

activity.Name: activity
activity.Description: The items that make up the pathway content.

detail.Name: detail
detail.Description: Detailed information about the pathway item.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The name of the pathway item.

description.Name: description
description.Description: The name of the section this item belongs to.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: The Pathway Step this item belongs to.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: The provider who applied the item.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: The name of the SmartGroup this item belongs to.

scheduledPeriod.Name: scheduledPeriod
scheduledPeriod.Description: The instant the item was applied.

statusReason.Name: statusReason
statusReason.Description: The reason entered if this item is overridden.

progress.Name: progress
progress.Description: The comment entered if this item is overridden.

author.Name: author
author.Description: The provider who initiated the pathway.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Type of plan. “inpatient-pathway” should be used to search for inpatient pathway CarePlan resource.

contributor.Name: contributor
contributor.Description: The provider who completed or discontinued the pathway.

created.Name: created
created.Description: The start date and time of the pathway.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter in which the pathway was started.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: The steps associated with the pathway.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: For Inpatient Pathways this always equals "plan".

note.Name: note
note.Description: The comment entered at pathway discontinuation or completion.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The start date and time of the pathway and the end date and time if completed or discontinued.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient or subject of this pathway.

supportingInfo.Name: supportingInfo
supportingInfo.Description: The reason entered for pathway discontinuation.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The display name of the Pathway.
